metadata.feature_description: Like and unlike posts and comments in the activity stream

steps.expected: Activity Stream posts should be visible
steps.actual: Activity Stream loaded with multiple posts visible

steps.action: Identify a post with Like button and click it
steps.expected: Like button should change to Unlike, and 'You like this' should appear
steps.actual: Clicked Like on 'Test post from Profile Activity Stream' - button changed to Unlike and 'You like this' appeared

steps.action: Click Unlike button on a previously liked post
steps.expected: Unlike button should change back to Like, and 'You like this' should disappear
steps.actual: Clicked Unlike - button changed back to Like and 'You like this' text disappeared

steps.action: Like a post and verify like count display updates
steps.expected: Like count or like indicator should update after liking
steps.actual: Liked 'Group Wiki Test Article' post - 'You like this' indicator appeared showing the like was registered

steps.action: Navigate to own post in Activity Stream
steps.expected: Own post should be visible with Like/Unlike button
steps.actual: Found first post by Anonymous (SuperUser Account) with Unlike button already showing user had liked it

steps.action: Verify own post can be liked
steps.expected: Own post shows like status with 'You like this' indicator
steps.actual: Own post shows 'Unlike' button and 'You like this' text, confirming user can like their own posts

steps.action: Click Like button on a comment
steps.expected: Comment Like button should change to Unlike, and 'You like this' should appear below comment
steps.actual: Clicked Like on comment 'Test comment for notification system testing' - button changed to Unlike and 'You like this' appeared

steps.expected: Like notifications should appear when posts are liked
steps.actual: Navigated to Notifications page - 3 notifications present but none are like notifications (notifications were for comment reports and wiki privileges)

issues: No like notifications observed. This is expected behavior in single-user testing since users don't receive notifications when they like their own content. Multi-user testing would be required to fully verify like notification functionality.

observations: Code review confirms ToggleLike API endpoint exists at ActivityStreamServicesController.cs lines 509-524, using JournalIntegrationController.Instance.ToggleLike() method
Like/Unlike functionality works correctly for both posts and comments
Like status persists and displays 'You like this' indicator when content is liked
Button text properly toggles between 'Like' and 'Unlike' based on current state
Multiple users liking same post scenario requires multiple user accounts to test properly - single-user testing limitation
Like notifications require multiple users to verify - when liking own content, no notification is generated to yourself (expected behavior)
